text:
Gentoo linux, Kernel 2.4.20 (incl. ptrace fixes), no additional modules

Apache starts fine (normal and with -X). On first access, it uses the entire
CPU, but does not react. This state then lasts forever -- no timeouts or the
likes. I believe this behavoiur first appeared after installing a 2.4.20 kernel
with ptrace-fixes.

strace-attempts die with " ptrace(PTRACE_PEEKUSER,23868,44,0): Operation not
permitted", gdb only gives "Couldn't get registers: Operation not permitted."

Any idea would be greatly appreciated.

Thx, Clemens
creator: coertel@web.de
slive@apache.org
text:
Obviously, this must be something specific to your setup, since we would be 
hearing alot more about it if it was a general problem.  As far as ptrace and
gdb, it sounds like you are trying to trace root processes from a non-root
login.

If you can provide more details about what is going on, feel free to reopen 
this.

The strace/gdb calls were made as user root. However, I finally decided to
switch to Apache II.
creator: coertel@web.de
